summary: Robert W. Genzman was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He is listed in payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These documents provide his name, and in some cases, his salary and gross pay during those periods. The documents serve as official records of his employment with the committee.
significance: Robert W. Genzman's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, though the specific nature and extent of his role are not detailed in these documents.
